Description: The `Animal Welfare Act (AWA) <https://www.nal.usda.gov/awic/animal-welfare-act>`_ is the Federal law in the US that regulates the treatment of animals in research, which is enforced by the `United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) <https://www.aphis.usda.gov/aphis/ourfocus/animalwelfare>`_
The IACUCs closely monitor the research and ensure that the research conducted is in accordance with all provisions of the PHS's **Policy on Humane Care and Use of Laboratory Animals**.

column2: `Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals <https://olaw.nih.gov/sites/default/files/Guide-for-the-Care-and-Use-of-Laboratory-Animals.pdf>`_
Description: The Guide is an internationally accepted primary reference on animal care and use, and its use is required in the United States by the PHS Policy.

`Policy Manual 3040-2: Animal Care and Use in the Intramural Program <https://policymanual.nih.gov/3040-2>`_ establishes responsibility for humane care and use of animals within the Intramural Research Program (IRP) of the National Institutes of Health (NIH).
An NIH regulator that provides oversight of all NIH-supported research activities that involve animals and ensure their compliance with animal welfare laws and policies.
At extramural research institutions, **IACUCs** evaluate all proposed research and are comprised of local scientists, nonscientists, community members, and veterinarians.

column2: `American Association for Accreditation of Laboratory Animal Care (AAALAC) <https://www.aaalac.org/>`_
Description: An independent body that assesses and accredits animal research programs around the world. NIH's animal research programs are AAALAC accredited.
